name: Walmart
accountContext: Global retailer focused on supply chain efficiency, store operations, and omnichannel execution.

buyingProcess.guess: Pilot opportunities are prioritized by measurable impact on store throughput and labor hours.
Enterprise integration and uptime expectations drive technical acceptance criteria.
Commercial terms typically require volume-based pricing and strict service-level commitments.

platformAndInfra: Cloud and SRE for retail workloads

name: Amazon
accountContext: Complex org with multiple buying centers across retail, logistics, and cloud organizations.

buyingProcess.guess: Initial discussion likely framed around business narrative and customer impact rationale.
Approval depends on performance at scale and security architecture review.
Vendor onboarding process includes legal redlines and operational readiness checks.

notes: Map decision path by org, not company-wide.

engineeringDecisionPath: Security and reliability gates at org level
Business owner and finance approve scoped adoption

name: UnitedHealth Group
accountContext: Healthcare enterprise balancing care quality, compliance, and operational efficiency.

buyingProcess.guess: Opportunities are prioritized by member outcomes and cost of care impact.
Regulatory and data protection controls likely determine technical viability.
Decision often depends on pilot evidence and deployment risk profile.

coreOrgs: Digital platform engineering for payer/provider workflows
platformAndInfra: Integration with clinical and claims systems
engineeringDecisionPath: Clinical/ops executive sponsor approves scaled rollout

name: Apple
accountContext: High standard for privacy, quality, and design alignment in partner evaluations.

buyingProcess.guess: Team aligns around measurable internal productivity and reliability goals.
Data handling and privacy controls likely represent strict gate criteria.
Final approval tied to long-term support commitments and clear SLA language.

engineeringDecisionPath: Engineering leadership screens for quality/privacy fit
Legal/procurement closes with strict support terms

name: CVS Health
accountContext: Cross-functional healthcare organization with payer, pharmacy, and care delivery teams.

buyingProcess.guess: Initiatives are filtered by member experience impact and operational savings.
Integration and security evidence likely required before procurement.
Commercial terms tied to phased implementation milestones.

notes: Show member and ops impact together.

engineeringDecisionPath: Program sponsor and procurement approve rollout

name: Berkshire Hathaway
accountContext: Decentralized portfolio means buying decisions vary by operating subsidiary.

buyingProcess.guess: Evaluation starts within subsidiary with local business case ownership.
Contract terms and liability structure often drive go/no-go decisions.
Approval depends on payback period and fit with subsidiary priorities.

platformAndInfra: Security and identity handled by each operating company
Integration typically scoped at business-unit level

name: Alphabet
accountContext: Large technical org requiring strong product justification and integration clarity.

buyingProcess.guess: Initial alignment centered on measurable developer or business productivity gains.
Scalability, SSO, and security posture likely drive technical buy-in.
Final terms focus on data governance and service reliability commitments.

engineeringDecisionPath: Senior engineering manager validates technical fit
Security and privacy checks for data handling

name: Exxon Mobil
accountContext: Energy major focused on operational reliability, safety, and long-horizon ROI.

buyingProcess.guess: Use cases prioritized by downtime prevention and throughput improvements.
Safety implications and reliability evidence are likely mandatory gates.
Final decision linked to multi-year return profile and implementation risk.

name: McKesson
accountContext: Distribution-driven business emphasizing accuracy, compliance, and network efficiency.

buyingProcess.guess: Focus likely on fill-rate performance and order cycle-time improvements.
Compliance fit and audit traceability reviewed before expansion.
Enterprise rollout contingent on pilot KPI lift and low implementation risk.

engineeringDecisionPath: Regulatory and quality stakeholders review controls
Ops and procurement approve expanded deployment

name: Cencora
accountContext: Global pharmaceutical services business with strict controls around quality and compliance.

buyingProcess.guess: Business case likely framed around throughput and service quality targets.
Quality systems and compliance alignment are likely hard requirements.
Pricing and delivery guarantees drive final agreement.

name: JPMorgan Chase
accountContext: Highly regulated financial institution with multiple business lines and strict risk governance.

buyingProcess.guess: Prioritization often tied to risk-reduction and processing efficiency gains.
Control evidence and auditability likely required before production approval.
Decision depends on vendor governance scoring and contractual safeguards.

platformAndInfra: Strong control and risk engineering layers
engineeringDecisionPath: Business sponsor plus third-party risk approves launch

name: Costco Wholesale
accountContext: Membership-led retailer focused on operational consistency and low-cost execution.

buyingProcess.guess: Evaluation begins with throughput, inventory accuracy, and labor efficiency gaps.
Pilot likely limited to a few warehouses before broader commitment.
Scale decision depends on clear pilot gains and minimal workflow disruption.

name: Cigna
accountContext: Enterprise account with cross-functional buying committee and multi-stage evaluation process.

buyingProcess.guess: Business team prioritizes based on measurable cost, risk, and speed outcomes.
Engineering and security teams validate integration, reliability, and control requirements.
Final stage focuses on commercial terms, support model, and implementation risk.

engineeringDecisionPath: Business sponsor and procurement approve rollout

name: Microsoft
accountContext: Large cross-functional environment with rigorous security and integration expectations.

buyingProcess.guess: Opportunity is framed around measurable productivity and platform alignment.
Architecture and security validation likely required before sponsor sign-off.
Final close depends on licensing fit and enterprise support terms.

engineeringDecisionPath: Business owner and procurement finalize terms

name: Cardinal Health
accountContext: Healthcare supply chain organization focused on fulfillment accuracy and compliance.

buyingProcess.guess: Initial phase benchmarks picking accuracy and cycle-time performance.
Pilot likely scoped to one or two facilities with strict KPI targets.
Scale approval depends on quality controls and acceptable commercial terms.

engineeringDecisionPath: Ops leadership and procurement approve wider rollout

name: Chevron
accountContext: Energy operations prioritize asset reliability, safety, and capital discipline.

stakeholders.name: Manager, Data Engineering for Asset Performance

buyingProcess.guess: Use cases evaluated by reliability and cost-per-barrel improvement potential.
Safety impact and engineering feasibility likely determine progression.
Funding decision tied to risk-adjusted return profile.

notes: Lead with uptime and safety outcomes.

name: Bank of America
accountContext: Large banking institution emphasizing control frameworks, resilience, and regulatory alignment.

buyingProcess.guess: Priorities set by efficiency potential and control-risk reduction.
Evidence of control design and monitoring likely required.
Final stage focuses on legal protections and vendor oversight commitments.

engineeringDecisionPath: Engineering director validates architecture and controls
Business sponsor + vendor governance approve go-live

name: General Motors
accountContext: Automotive manufacturer modernizing product engineering, plant systems, and connected vehicle software delivery.

buyingProcess.guess: Evaluation likely starts with one plant/program where throughput and quality KPIs are measurable.
Architecture review focuses on MES, quality systems, and vehicle software toolchain integration.
Pilot success depends on measurable cycle-time, rework, and downtime improvements.
Final approval tied to plant rollout plan, support model, and total cost profile.

notes: Lead with plant throughput and quality metrics.
Propose phased plant rollout with clear governance.

platformAndInfra: Plant execution and telemetry data systems
engineeringDecisionPath: Manufacturing + platform engineering validate technical feasibility
Executive sponsor and procurement approve scale

name: Ford Motor
accountContext: Automotive manufacturer balancing product programs, plant operations, and supply chain constraints.

stakeholders.name: SVP, Ford Pro & Digital Systems Engineering

buyingProcess.guess: Need identification likely starts with throughput and quality bottlenecks by plant.
Pilot proves integration with existing manufacturing systems and workflows.
Scale approval depends on cost profile and implementation timeline confidence.

notes: Focus on plant throughput and quality.

name: Elevance Health
accountContext: Healthcare benefits enterprise scaling digital member experience, care operations platforms, and data-driven workflows.

buyingProcess.guess: Priority usually based on member experience, care outcome, and admin-efficiency impact.
Engineering review likely emphasizes interoperability, reliability, and operational controls.
Regulatory and privacy requirements are typically hard gates before production use.
Approval depends on quantified ROI and low-risk implementation sequencing.

notes: Lead with member and care outcomes.
Map controls to healthcare compliance needs.
Offer phased deployment by business unit.

engineeringDecisionPath: Platform engineering validates architecture and controls
Executive and finance sponsors approve staged rollout
